content: Excellent game. Serious old school Dragon Warrior Monsters vibes, which was a huge part of my childhood. Love the monster designs and the procedural generation.

It doesn't have the best graphic or spectacle. But it has some of the best monster taming gameplay. The team building element is strong and its not about having a single strongest monster but rather to have a really good functioning team. Recommended for anyone searching their monster taming fix. The control and the graphic might be meh, but the gameplay is better than alot of monster taming game.
I really want keyboard controls for this game, since I had this game on console first.
Good game for 5 bucks. Especially considering there's no microtransactions. Reminds me of the dragon warrior monsters games from the gameboy era.
Deep, engrossing and old skool. Highly recommend for rpg fans who dont need flashy graphics. Over 700 monsters and over 350 spells....all customisable....perfect
Totally worth the money.
keep up the good work this game hasn't gotten stale plenty of intriguing ways to approach the game with so many strategies
Amazing game, very addictive grindy kinda game. Played for hundreds of hours across siralim 1, 2 and 3 both on android and steam. Can't wait for Siralim Ultimate in Feb/March 🥳
Excellent game. Like old school dragon warrior monsters but so much better.
Great game!

This review is mostly for players of the first 2 games. Definitely pick this up if you've never played any Siralim before. The joystick and double movement speed make this game much more manageable on mobile than the last 2. Instead of randomized realms, each depth has a realm tied to it (keep in mind ive only hit floor 11 so far). The whole game feels more streamlined too. There are tons of customization options to keep a lot of the clicking and scrolling to a minimum too. Would recommend!
Great game

What a pleasant surprise of a game. Very impressed. Highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys turn-based JRPGs / monster collection games / rogue-like dungeon crawlers. Lots of different combat build variations and mechanics. This game has a TON of content and gives off a wonderful nostalgic vibe. I'm thoroughly enjoying it so far. Definitely worth checking out! Mad props to the developers for making such a unique 'passion project' kind of game. Love it!
Dragon Warrior Monsters is one of my favorite games of all time, and Siralim 3 is a reimagined DWM with a lot more depth and customization.

Very good game. You can play unlimited. There's a lot of depth to your creatures. You can buff your creatures with enchanted artifacts. The list goes on. It's really a fun game. You won't be disappointed.
10 stars if I could, love the work, love the game! Siralim Ultimate??? Can't wait!!!
Great game. Easy to sink hours in it without the pain of inapp purchases.
One of the best RPGs I've played.
I would say it is kind of grindy, but has amazing depth. The team combs, the gear setups, the spells... I play it on the pc also, love it so far!

My first experience with 'monster taming' games -- I come from the old-school DnD RPG, rougelike, and strategy games, so this was new for me. But I think I chose the right one to try the genre! Love the depth and layers upon layers of content. The graphics are kind of retro, but so am I so I like them -- plus I love the fact that there are no doe-eyed, cutsie monsters! Gameplay can be kind of grindy, but there's SO MUCH content and things to do that it never feels like a chore. Excellent game!
Can be obtuse at times, but one of the deepest rpgs on the platform. Btw you unlock breeding on floor 17
Absolutely loving it.
Game is enjoyable, and no iaps or ads, a true gem among these nasty so called "games" here in playstore. Price is very cheap too.

Played 70 hours (within 5 days, i might add) on PC, now bought it for Android. One of the best games in the genre - real depth, hundreds of monsters, endless team possibilities. Definitely worth the money. I've encountered only one small problem: As i started by importing my savefile from pc, and it was a real pain in the ass to type in the cloud id with the default pad. I'd prefer if the directional pad was set as default.
Old school style, endless adventure.

Pretty fun game if you liked games like Pokemon Mystery dungeon, Monster Rancher, and other similar turnbased dungeon exploring with monsters. Yes it costs money to buy at first but its better than stupid gamed having secondary currency that lowkey coerce you to buy it

I enjoy the game mechanics of assigning traits and spells and developing synergy to build your own unique team. And since dungeons are always newly generated, it's a good investment for the price. My only aggravation is the colour scheme and design of some of the realms, such as Meraxis or Regalis. I have partial colour blindness and some realms are more unpleasant and anxiety-inducing than others.

This game is Mr. Steal Yo Girl for the Pokemon series. Interesting combinations of abilities, traits and techniques doesn't say the half of it. Upon looking at the gameplay, you'll think that this game seems pretty deep, but it just keeps revealing itself more and more. Turbo mode and macros are great for QoL, because my team build is getting to be... intensive. Great work dev on this, you have a series to be proud of. I'll see you in Ultimate!! (Backed the Kickstarter)
Lovely. Great cross-platform game.
Perfect lockdown game
The game may have lack luster visuals, but there is engaging and deep gameplay under the hood. Love the cloud feature so I can play my account through mobile and switch.
Phenomenally deep, especially for the price. Very highly recommended.

Own Siralim 1-3 on pc and jumped at the chance to grab 3 on mobile. This game is great for killing time and is a fun creature collecting rpg. The game uses overlay controls incase that's something that's off-putting for you but I honestly didn't mind them myself and there are options to customize controls as well which helps. The game has a ton to do and lots of end game content, if you have any interest at all in these kinds of games it's worth the $5, excellent mobile port.
cant import macros,macros too finicky
I dont have enough good things to say about this game its amazing i wish it was still getting updates and even more content

One of the densest RPG experiences in the playstore. The amount of content this game has to offer is staggering. If you as a gamer owns a nostalgic heart and a soft spot for JRPG's, this comes highly recommended. Most of the gameplay revolves around monster catching, training, and battling other wild parties of monsters, but so much more. Breed unique creatures, look for buried treasure, equip your party with custom forged equipment, enhance spells suited to your playstyle...huge game! Very fun!

Purchased yesterday, figured it'd be a small time waster while stuck in the house. Completely addicted. 11 hours of play time as of this review I haven't even owned it a full 24hours. One issue I have isn't even the games fault, which is I can't get my ps4 controller to sync properly for playing. Still loving the game, takes me back to my Dragon Quest Warriors days. I'm sure I'll be playing this for a while.
Fun so far!
Amazing job on this game! You improved the things that bothered me in the 2nd one and kept the same great nostalgic feel of the game! One of my favorite time killers!
Great game good depth and plenty of monsters to catch
Full of content. Well worth the price for as much time as I've put into it. It has a good story line and plenty of post game content. It reminds me of playing DWM2, but with tons of improvements
Really enjoying this game so far. Great job dev.

It is a truely unique gaming experience, i feel like anything i have to say about it will sound generic, wich this game isn't. If you enjoy the JRPG, or the Monster Slave fighting type games, this is for you! And you will like it more than most of them that you have played. (Monster Slave games that is.)
game has no mtx and ads support indie devs; the devs are trying their best to be admins but they arent the best at it
I love the game, but I need an "if any living enemy" and an "if enemy (all living)" macro. Please?
Awesome game! Very retro, and takes me back to the Dragon Quest days. Definitely worth the purchase!
I have spent 60 hours in the last week playing this

About as close to perfect as any game can be. Unlimited things to do, collect, and customize. All for a small one time payment. Can be really hard at times. Especially early on when you are figuring things out, or when you run into enemies that seem to have the answer for your current strategy. Typically a little tweak, or a little grinding, is all it takes to get past any roadblocks.
The Siralim series is fantastic as always. Props to the dev for sticking with the formula while still expanding and polishing the experience.
It is a gem.
If you love roguelikes, grinding, Pokemon dungeon, or all the above... THIS IS YOUR GAME! thanks Dev!

First of all I think this game is great! Why not 4 or 5 stars? I read this game is cross platform and I thought I could play it on the PC. I spent $5 on Google Play to now find out I must spend $15.00 to play my saved game data on my PC. Well I'm not going to buy the game twice, and now I'd prefer a full refund as I rather play on my PC then my phone any day!
If your not playing this game, you should be. So fun and addicting. Great price, great game, and you can play your save game on multiple platforms. Buy it now!
Super fun monster breeding game. Well worth $5. No micro transactions and lots of depth. Graphics are a bit on the retro side but for a phone game I think it's endearing.
ANDROID PLAYSTORE, STOP LICENCE-CHECKING THE OFFLINE GAME THAT I PAID FOR. I DON'T HAVE INTERNET ACCESS ALL THE TIME AND YOU'RE JUST OBFUSCATING YOUR OWN PRODUCT. IT DOESN'T EVEN MAKE SENSE?
replyContent: Hi Mr. Lastname, sorry the inconvenience! Unfortunately, that verification is out of my hands and is entirely an issue on Google's end.

content: Decent time killer rogue-lite rpg with terrible graphics but interesting gameplay. Sadly, the Cloud storage option does not work on this Samsung Galaxy phone (could not connect to the cloud at all).
Its like a better dqm

Great game. Love everything about it except I think it would be better if there was some RNG on the level up stats of newly hatched creatures. It would give breeding an in depth role, to see if you can breed the best creature possible. Just a thought.
Worth paying. Value for your money. Try. Guys.

The Siralim series is Pokemon for adults. The story, while not the main focus, is entertaining. The characters and dialog are surprisingly well written. Lots of turn based strategy and counter balance keeps long term play viable. Well worth the $5. Oh I almost forgot .... The cloudsave system provides the ability to play an a different device or even in steam if you want. Probably on iOS too but I haven't tried it.
A lot of fun so far!

Amazing mobile game, perfect combo of building teams, collecting, achievements. Feels like pokemon, disgaea, and a sort of like a card game . Building a dope team that works off each others abilities feels kick ass.
Great monster battler with tons and TONS of customization options. Someone likened this to mtg because of the great combos you can create with each monster in your team. Awesome.
Absolutely amazing game!
Treat imling best Halloween idea chaos to all my turns just comes naturally "pun intended"
Fun game
i always enjoy this game. each new release only adds more and more as well.

Monster collector, spell customizer, squad tactics, perk evolver... this game has it all and then some! You can even collect and upgrade talismans for permanent buffs [and they even let you choose to turn them off and on] You can play at your own pace in quick 10 min or less maps or go for longer runs..

This game is absolutely amazing, you people have done something wonderful an shared it with the world. This game reminds me with aspects of: dragon warrior, azure dreams, an jade cocoon. So much to do in this game an build your monsters, not to mention when you can start breeding an combining monsters! I'd have to say the Skeleton Triggerman is prob 1 of my favs 😎 Simple, I know. But its effective 😃
Excellent, deep and creative RPG. Dungeon crawling doesn't get much better than this! 5/5 stars!
Disgaea or Pokemon-like creature collector game, very fair business model, buy it once and you have access to everything.
Probably the most content you'll ever get on mobile for 5 bucks. So glad I got this game!
Cheap and fun, plus you can play the same save file on pc.
Its just like dragon warrior monsters bruh i love it good job guys

Very happy with this game so far for the price tag. I was initially worried about the quality of the sprites but I'm not minding them too much because the game itself is great. Deep and immersive monster catching rpg with a sense of humor.
Fantastic game,
Chocobos dungeoni 2 + jade cocoon with macros? Sign me up!! Loving the game. Plot is a little goofy, but it doesn't matter with gameplay like this.
I was put off by the screenshots at first, but this is a seriously awesome game for any fan of the original Dragon Warrior Monsters. Give it a chance.
No game is better for a quick distraction or just something to do while watching Netflix. It's deep enough to hold your engagement without any rush.
Amazing and fun, keep up the hard work!

This game has consumed a good chunk of my spare time for the last several weeks. It's great, and it scratches a monster collecting/breeding genre itch I've had long since unscratched. The one star reviews look to mostly be from people who couldn't be bothered to read basic gameplay instructions, so please don't let that turn you off from this game!

An amazingly deep and content-rich game with (literally) 1000+ hours of playtime.  I've played for almost a year thus far using cross-save support between mobile and steam (also has cross save to switch which I don't have), and there's still a lot more that I want to do.  The game has an active developer and solid discord.  Zero microtransactions, just a great game.
ludicrously long and slow tutorial that cannot be skipped. avoid this game.
this is a wonderful game. i love it so much.

An otherwise great game with some minor clunkiness. What kills the mobile version is the lack of quick saving. You get half way through a level and then IRL calls. When you come back the game resets and all of that progress is gone.
great old school feel pokemon meets monster rancher although I avern brawls are very vroken sonim staying away from them
awesome game and love that I can play in bed or at computer!
This game is like pokemon meets MTG with NES style graphics. It's great. Also, it's an actual game, not a money milking app.
the only rpg mobile game worth downloading tbh

I cannot even begin to think about where to start with this review. This game is just filled to the brim with stuff to do. As the third in a series, this is probably the most distilled version of Siralim. In a nutshell, it's a monster hunting and collecting game with base building, tons of customization, a rich rpg experience and a fun story. It is finished but it's still developed and improved upon, and I am excited to see how the game evolves.
love it
Premium 93
Easily worth more than the 5 bucks I spent on it.

The game DELETED all of my saves, local and on the cloud, after many hours of play with no warning! Everything I collected gone instantly. Then it crashed on "continue" and when I try to import from the cloud. Update if I make a new character it saves and continues, but my old saves haven't returned. I'll update the review if it's fixed.
fantastic game with unlimited time sink capability
Not only boring, but I'll not be cussed by a game I paid for. Refunded and 1 star Don't get snippy with me because your game sucks. 1 star is being kind and you know it.
replyContent: You must be a blast at parties!

content: Great RPG. Has some roguelike elements like random gen maps and RNG items.
Siralim is a good game to playing during work breaks.

Fun and original. Creators did something smart by focusing on game mechanics and gameplay instead of flashy graphics. Dont let the simple graphics fool you, this game has something for the casual gamer and the player who likes to dig into more complex strategies.

Good game all in all, but feels like a step down in gameplay from Siralim 2. if you already played 2, this one is different enough to be worth it. if you haven't played 2, I suggest getting it over 3.
Great game, though it does a security check on occasion to make sure the games legit on android. Which will keep popping up till your online. Which makes a semi online game as far android goes.
replyContent: Hi, unfortunately, that's not something I can control. If a game exceeds a certain file size, Google forces this check.

content: absolutly great! if this game gets alot of downloads could you make a editor or sandbox mode? I want to be able to put together my own teams and create my own items without limit, and fight my own battles. if not its fine but this would be the perfect game for it.
fun and unique monster tamer game
best mobile game by far 💖💖💖💖💖
Awesome monster capture game, like a more mature and detailed Pokemon style game. I had seen it in steam for years.. finally got around to it.. great choice.
This is a very in depth and deep monster catching game! Well with the price tag, so give it a try!

I just want to start off by saying this game is absolutely amazing. the gameplay is strategic and fun and the realms are a lot of fun to explore. there is so much to do here and I'm gonna be playing this game for a long time.
Best played with a controller
Great addition to the series

it was entertaining at first, but the huge amounts of breeding recipes and monsters coupled with the limitations to breeding until you unlock those recipes makes the game lose it's appeal rather quickly. I put it down shortly after realizing I couldn't experiment with breeding as you can in Dragon Warrior Monsters. Also the plot line feels empty.
replyContent: Hi Kyle! Just so you know, you actually can experiment with breeding combinations like in DWM. You don't *need* to find the recipes first - they're just there to help you out since there are so many possible combinations.

content: I love this game, but the control pad is hard to use. Thanks for making me feel guilty about the Treasure Golem, I didnt need that!
replyContent: Hi Erik! You might want to configure the controls in the options menu. Some people prefer the directional pad over the joystick, and you might also want to adjust the size to suit your needs.

content: I am an old boy. I grew up playing Pixel Rpgs and Pokemon back in the GBC to GBA days, I also play Magic the Gathering. This game is a combination of all my childhood games. Absolutely brilliant and perfect for old nerds like me. Thanks Dev.
Fantastic. The feel of 8-bit RPGs with some deep statistic / team composition experimentation available.

Cheap mechanics. Your monsters will be 10 levels higher then the dumb A.I. monsters and the only reason why it has any difficulty is the enemy will almost always go first and beat your monsters to death often targeting all on one of your creatures (usually your healer to remove that from play) I'm so tired of games that pretend to have a difficulty curve but it's just they get to move before you. I don't want to hear ANY bs about speed stats that's bs with how glitchy this game is. Garbage.
replyContent: Hi Corey! You said you don't want to hear about the Speed stat, but that's entirely the issue here, so I'm not really sure what to tell you.

content: It doesn't mention in the description that the game uses an overlay d-pad controller. Those kinds of games never translate well, and the button overlay prints on top of script and gameplay.
replyContent: How exciting would it be if one of the features on the store page was "includes on-screen touch controls!"

content: Best Mobile Game experience. Extremely in depth but still casual friendly, no ads everywhere, no pay to win strategies. Old school looks with a modern feel and smooth performance. Amazing.
Fun overall I enjoy the limitless aspect of it a lot although hatching eggs could be a little more of a fun gamble and it's sad that Siralim is offline

Steep learning curve, however, It tugs on my Nostalgia strings from the glory days of Dragon Warrior Monsters. No ads, no microtransactions that I can see, if this is a genre you are interested in, you will not regret the purchase.
Great monster taming RPG. Surprising depth and lots of choices in building a team.

Lots of control options, great performance considering the depth, and most importantly insanely fun. I will say depth again, because this isn't a typical mobile game. No microtransactions or time gates, just monster collecting with potentially hundreds of hours of content if you want to see it all. Well worth full price, a rare breed in this market.
i bought the game and i keeo getting a error stating "unable to get valid license" how do i fix this? will rerate afterwards!!
replyContent: Hi, you need to be connected to WiFi the first time you run the game. It's a Google licensing requirement - nothing we can do on our end, unfortunately.

content: awesome.
I love it. I can finish my session with this game on PC, save & upload it to the cloud, then carry on in bed using my phone. There goes my life but hey, it's worth it.
Siralim is like pokemon on steroids, and this third in the series is a fine improvement on the formula.
Heck, who needs a woman? I don't. With Siralim 3, life is much more interesting. i don't answer my phone anymore. Too busy. .At least now i know what the next 2 years of my life will revolve around
Really fun. Reminds me of the old Dragon Warrior: Monsters games that I loved. Developer also continues to add creatures with promo passwords.

An absolutely wonderful game! I'm only 11 stages in and am already having a blast creating weird teams. I would EASILY give it 5 stars if I had working audio. As it stands, when I play, there's absolutely no sound. Media volume is at max, as is the in-game volume. Has anyone else had this issue?

so um. Yeah I had my doubts about this game I just started and got bombarded with sweet deals and things to push me to play the game and I was like ok this is pretty awesome, but then i was playing right ? And I was eating fruit and I just threw up and got some loot now that's awesome keep up the good work....
Amazing game.

the only reason I'm not still playing this game is because my gaming tablet broke and this is a rather large game. it is a full game for a small price and exactly what I want out of this genre of game. The only things that I would like is to be able to skip the tutorial (because the God of anger gets really annoyingafter a while) and maybe a non pixelated creature gallery, and that is it. I love this game, and the people who made it are my favorite game creators.
Very fun!!
basically Siralim 2 but with more stuff
dank
Sometimes vampiric aura and splash don't work even if i have overheal. I think damage dealt by censure and shining force(perks of life mage) don't work with splash and vampiric aura
fantastic game; runs, as expected, slower on the phone than on the PC. Still; not TOO bad!

The controlls are a bit odd at first but once you get used to it they work really well. Once i figured out the controlls and got past the tutorial I realised how massive of a game this is and how much work the developers put into it. I've played it for a bit over 2 hours and I feel like I've barely scratched the surface. Highly recommended it to any JRPG fans!
Great game, developer very responsive
great except my saves randomly stop working otherwise game is phenomenal for the price tag
Like a grown up Dragon Quest Monsters. The graphics make me think of the cutting edge of Gameboy Color
Its good if you like Dragon Warrior: Monsters
Fun, good time killer. In depth customization. Been playing since the first one :)
Insanely deep
good game
Haven't beaten it yet but I'm enjoying a lot so far. Reminds me a lot of Dragon Quest Monster for the Gameboy.
Mechanically driven monster-collecting RPG, with a sense of humor! Perfect for fans of Dragon Quest Monsters.

I want everyone to know that I have purchased this game one time. I have only contributed funds to the developer on a singular occasion... This game updates daily at times. I've never seen a week pass without an update. This developer puts more into this game from a single monetary compensation than most FtP games that are PtW. This developer deserves recognition... One more thing, the updates are small. It isn't a game that wants to burn your data up.
What an absolutely amazing game. I cant stop playing
good
Better than the both of the sequels for sure, I love it!
simply amazing. so much to do
its ok

Gameplay deep monster taming RPG. Abilities, skills, equipment, breeding, loot, interactive landscape - this game leaves no stone unturned in terms of gameplay. Highly recommend to any fan of turn based RPGs, especially if you are always trying to create the strongest possible team compositions.

this game has been a blast so far, I'm 13 realms deep and each new level is a decent challenge. I've noticed a nice increase in difficulty as I get further, so it keeps it fun. It is obvious how much work was put into this game l, and I for one love it. lots of lore and game mechanics to learn. I look forward to continuing the story. edit- I'm now at realm 48 and it definitely has grown immensely.

This game is all I play on my phone now. I'd given up in mobile gaming because of greed in f2p games and many of the b2p games not comfortable to play casually on a phone. This game would be perfect for me if they added google play achievements. No complaints otherwise. The amount of detail and care put into gameplay, control and ui configuration is phenomenal. It has everything I've wanted in a game. I will probably by it for my Switch when that launches as well. Thank you!
sooooo awesome
Fun, deep and essentially infinite.
Excellent Game! The developer is super active!

Fantastic game with tons of monsters to collect, battle system is deep, craft weapons with many attributes, randomized dungeons are packed with loot as well. You can also pick up and play your save file from mobile to pc and back to mobile, super handy!
so much gameplay and cross platform support really seals the deal. Get it!
Great game. Plenty to do, still exploring. Will update for end game content review.
Great game for a great price. Hundreds of hours of gameplay to discover in the depths of this instant classic.
I like depth. This game has depth. Unlike my review.
This is probably the best, original game I've played for my phone. Humor and story arent great but the sheer content and challenge paired with my love for monsters makes this an easy 5 for me.
i wanted to catch monster and make them kill other monsters. thats what i got. Would kill monsters with monsters again.
great writing ; Torun is very funny!
Got the game for the combat macros and now I've realized they are bugged. I wish I could still refund.

One of the best games I have EVER played mobile or otherwise. This is not a game for everyone however. There is a certin type of game player who will like this. The whole point of the game is to grind, if you are not into that stay away. 30 hours so far and many more to come.

Takes the best parts of the last game, removes the bad, and brings an insane amount of new content. 5 bucks is a steal. The in-app purchases are all very non-essential, and don't hinder the experience if you don't want to get them.
A fan since the first
awesome 👍

The best Pokemon-style game for anyone who is looking for great strategic depth. Imagine if each Pokemon had a unique game-altering passive ability... for instance a starter in Siralim 3: any time a spell is cast by anyone on your team, this creature casts a random spell from the same school of magic. And you can also get these have-alluring abilities on an item, meaning your six-monster team can have 12 abilities... The ridiculous combos you can set up are amazing.
A grindy monster collector game with some improvements over the first two. Try out 2 for free before buying.
If there is a more detailed, in-depth, replayable RPG for android.. please point me in that direction.
Excellent
i think i only need to play 1-2k hrs more to finish this game.
Fantastic game!!!
very deep and ton of stuff to do

one of the best mobile games I've come across in a long time. The dungeon floors are just the right size for short periods of play, while the game has enough depth to keep me going when I just want to kill a few hours. Gameplay is really easy for casual players, but though a who take the time to really learn the mechanics will find a unique challenge when it comes to building their perfect team. The only really negative thing I can say is that it really burns through my battery life pretty quick
Great game. Bought it twice. I discovered Siralim games after deleting SWGOH. This is the kind of game that I wish the F2P RPG's I've tried was.
additive
awesome even better than siralim 2 so far :)
Amazing turn based rpg.

I can't play anymore because I know the next hour of gameplay will be just like the last hour. I hate to say anything bad about this game but it's very repetitive and grindy. The "extended tutorial" until max level just isn't fun. It's the same levels just different colors. Sometimes you unlock something but none of it is exciting or will change how you play. I hate the idea of suffering through any game with the hope that it will get better eventually.
Hi, Thylacine team! Love the previous game in the series. Today, i buy the game and i can't play it. They appear unable to get a valid licence message. Please help! Thank you!
very fun.
phenominal
great game well worth the few bucks I paid
amazing game keeps you hooked fornhours and some of the featurss that combat the grindy feeling of the game are great too
great game. you can tell someone cared about making this game. not about profits. you won't regret downloading it
final fantasy pokemon

it's a good game. I like the 1 time purchase and then you dont have to keep feeding the game money like pretty much every other app... concept is good, and the game can give you so many hours of enjoyment. I RARELY review games, but this one deserves mine. thank you for developing the right way!

Siralim 3 is the only version of the game you should be playing. Each version is more of an update rather than a sequel and this has lots of quality of life additions that make the other games seem painful to play. its the best game on Android I think.
I've put in over 100 hours into this game so far and from what i can tell I'm nowhere near done.

One of the most amazing indie RPGs out there. Endless gameplay and tons of creatures to collect, train and breed. The developer put their heart and soul into the game and has listened to tons of feedback from players to make this game the best of the series.

love the game and played since 1 but the worst thing about this app is it lags so much on my phone I have a S5 and I'm sad because It feels so slow (I played 1 on pc and 2 on ps4 and they ran amazingly tho on better systems it shouldn't lag this bad for phone) I was hoping if there's a fix for it or something
Good game. I think I liked 2 better, especially the crafting system, but still well worth the purchase.
Great game, great devs, very active in updating and speaking with the community.
Great game loved the first two installments

Updated review because the excruciating early-game slog is no more! The updates make starting out so much less frustrating, getting past the first few stages no longer feels like a luck-based mission. And once you really start to have team synergy options open up, look out, you might never put the game down again. The depth in Siralim 2 never ceased to amaze me, and 3 is so much better in pretty much every respect.
I'm going to enjoy playing this on my 15 hour flight. This is a fun game to collect monsters and loot in a randomized world.
Simply amazing!

It's like somebody who enjoys this genre wrote the game. It's really well done. Fantasy rpg meets pokemon meets power gamer's dream. You could probably grind your way through all the content quickly enough. The real joy is the theorycrafting about team building. So many combinations, so many things to try.

So addicted! I have literally dreamed of a game like this. Best phone game in my opinion. There's depth such as crafting, enchanting, spells, creatures and much more. 10 hours in and I still can't put it down. Highly recommended.

Only about 4 hours in. If your looking for a well thought out and deep experiance, this is the game for you. Many layers to this RPG. Honestly blown away by the complexity this game show. If you look at my profile i have given a go most RPG games on the market. This one by far stands out as an honest AAA mobile experience. Well done to the team who produced such a well designed and polished RPG. No pay wall, well worth the money. Could say more but i spoke as a fan not a critical reviewer.

Only,game I've. never paid for and thought.. wow that was the worth the money plus a lot more this is by far the best game I have ever played since old school RPGs or World of Warcraft.. my only big complains are.. 1.) why take away leveling artifacts and lower from 10 to 6 2.) Macros are so nice and helpful, unless your adeath mage then 5 of your creatures you can't assign macros to cuz they are summoned.. 3.) what i want most is multiple pvp modes. like a ladder without scaling everyone down
No more power balance, rejoice!

I love the Siralim games and played previous versions on my older devices, but unfortunately on screen controls are rather awkward to use on my newer Tab S4. I'm hoping since this dev has proven extremely active in past versions of the game that keyboard and/or mouse support might be added in the near future, as that would make this a game I could easily sink large chunks of time into. Without it, I'm forced to uninstall. Too bad, as I was really looking forward to this one.
Just as good as Siralim 2 with some welcome new features. Only thing I want is some new game plus features.

This is the only game you need if you are even remotely interested in rpg games or Pokemon like games. I have bought this game on the pc and on my phone and will do it for every console if needed. this developer is THE best and deserves all my money and yours.
amaizing game.
great game...10 stars!!

This game is soooo awesome! It masterfully combines the improvements made in the second game with exciting new features that have had me glued for the last month racking up over 160 hours thus far with plenty of untouched content left to get lost in. The game is updated frequently with not only gameplay fixes and improvements but also with fresh content/expansions and temporary "holiday events" keeping you excited to check out new content and challenges. Siralim 3 has earned my 5 star review. :)
Litterally the best game in the Android store. Tons of fun and great value! Like DQ Monsters but better.
Once again, the game that cripples me and causes my life to stop. Who needs success when you have Siralim 3?
Seems like a fun game but the lack of an autosave feature makes this game much less enjoyable.

Cloud storage is broken! Says it can't connect and to try again later. There's nothing wrong with my connection, or the permissions for this game. Besides that, it seems pretty good so far, even though one hour on all of my monsters together have one active cast spell. I assume it starts opening up more in terms of strategy soon. Edit: cloud storage is fixed!

content: What mobile games should be. its not a gatcha game. This dev is amazing and cares about his product. It oozes with passion! Truely indie game of the year.
great
love it!
Very deep Pokemon-like RPG. If you like games that ask you to find combos between abilities and build parties based on them, this game is for you.

Siralim 3 is an extremely deep monster catching RPG. There is a near limitless amount of content. With a style and feel similar to old school Dragon Warrior Monsters, this game is refreshing and unique compared to today's games. The graphics hold the charms of a similar time, with many quality of life perks that we have come to love. Siralim 3 is a game that will give you hundreds, if not thousands, of hours of entertainment.
Favorite current game. Endless. Great music! Earlier performance issues resolved per 1.3.X updates!

The best game on googleplay. Played the first. Bought the second one. And bought the third game. If you like pokemon, give this a try. Well worth the price tag for the huge amount of content. 10/10 would buy this any day.

Very fun, like it's predecessors. Battle, collect, and breed (fuse) monsters in classic RPG turn based battles. Just be prepared to deal with on-screen controls that no matter how much you adjust them will never feel like they are in the right place and will constantly be missed by a hair over and over. That's my only complaint, I'm getting used to it and it doesn't make Siralim 3 unplayable, just annoying at times.
Fun game. There are tons of monsters to choose from and many ways to customize your party.
worth it
It's a blend of Pokémon and roguelike dungeon crawler with seemingly endless options at your disposal. I would have gladly paid double the price for a game of this quality.
This is one of the rarely good mobile games I have played.
Think Pokemon, Shin Megami Tensei, that other monster taming game I can't remember the name of - it's got all the good things those games had and more.
Grindy fun.....
Not sure how this got a near perfect review... The controls are horrid, everything is way too small... Who is giving these reviews?

Pull the trigger and buy it! The amount of gameplay and depth is amazing. I'm really enjoying it.
So far so good, already had the first two, happy to see a sequel.
Love it!!!!

Amazing game. Any fans of Dragon Quest would love this. I played Siralim 2 for hundreds of hours. Excited to do the same here.
Truly awesome game series. Highly recommended for people who enjoy rpgs with deep customization.
Verry interesting dungeon crawler. You control a team of up to 6 creatures. Turn based combat. Procedurally generated game/dungeon levels with scalable dufuculty.

As always amazing work! With the added plus of a story to this one. I know this just came out recently but I'm really looking forward to what you do next. You've solidified your work and standing as an Indie Dev. And though I'll never tire of Siralim, we'd love to see what else you can come up with. Kudos!
Good Game. Regular improvements are actually meaningful. That keeps me playing. That's just my opinion.
I never finished 2. I lost all my data and couldn't bring myself to start again. 3 is a perfect re start. If it's anywhere as good as 2 it's probably one of the best games on the store

Bought all three. Can't wait for the fourth. Great game. Buy it you will not regret it. The description is dead on. If you a lover of rpg's this will be one of you favorites once you really get into it.

This was an automatic buy for me as soon as I saw it. Its a great game made by an amazing developer in a top notch series. I have never seen a developer that responds as quickly to his customers before.
top quality with a team that is all the time active for helping the community and a one that listens to its community too

I was told by a friend to play the first Siralim but at the time I was not that into its graphics. Later on I was again told that I would like Siralim 2 by the same friend and eventually--awhile after it had been out--I gave it a chance and loved it. However, it wasn't that long after I was playing it that Siralim 3 was announced. I waited for it to go to mobile as I lack internet for my computer atm. And after one of my random Siralim 3 searches in google apps, it showed up. I didn't hesitate at all to buy it right then and there and I am loving every minute of it I play. It has a somewhat customizable main (you have preset sprites you can change into). A vast array of monsters you can raise. So much loot you can find in the way of artifact equips, spell gems, and various other boosts such as runes & cards. And the Gods are genuinely interesting in how they interact. Maybe because Nex seems set-up for helping them rather than how Siralim got their assistance, they seem much more fun to see and do quests for. Oh, and the music is amazing. Maybe I had my music too low in 2 but in 3 I love the music and don't want to just play my vocaloids over it while I play. So overall, a damn great game that any monster raising game fan should get. Our game genre keeps dropping off (monster rancher, jade cocoon, and so on) or never coming to the west (dragon quest monsters joker 3) so a gem like this needs love and support. ^.^

It's exactly what I was expecting/hoping it would be when I read the description and reviews of others. Except I was hoping I could play it on my computer as well without paying more. It's way overpriced on steam in my opinion.
replyContent: It's actually underpriced on Google Play!

content: These best monster game I play long time thank you.
Very responsive developer, same great Siralim gameplay with quality of life improvements.
Great time sink strategy game with tons of different content to sink your teeth into. So good, I've got it on Steam and mobile! Highly recommended

It's an okay game! Perfect for when you're bored, but it is only a game about grinding. That is fine, it doesn't hide this fact. It's all grind and RNG and it was fun, but after awhile I'm kind of burnt out.
Fantastic step up and continuation of an already great series.
Excellent companion to the steam version.
I love this series, and the fact I can import my save file from Steam... genius
Amazing follow up from the first 2 games. Unique and entertaining!

This is another Siralim game, which is a good thing. I personally miss the random realms, lack of stat caps, and a couple other things, but for the most part, it's a good enough sequel to make sure that Siralim will be around for the next game. It's better for the game to Siralim well than be too different and lose touch with what made it great. Good job.

The game itself is not terrible, but it's a different sort of game than its predecessor. Balanced better maybe, with some QoL improvements, but it also takes some major steps backwards. The new breeding system makes it all but pointless to breed monsters, which is a baffling choice for a monster catching and breeding game, really. IMO, skip this game and play Siralim 2 instead. Edit to add: cloud saves are fixed, but breeding is still pointless and 2 is still more fun. The dev is super responsive though, points for that.
replyContent: The issue you talked about should be fixed now! Just need to update. Thanks for your patience!

content: Excellent game. Follows up on the previous with improvements while still preserving everything I loved.
The Siralim series is amazing and gets better with each game. It reminds me of Dragon Warrior Monsters in all the best ways.
Fun old school feel. Certain fights a bit over ridiculous (level 18 end fight is silly) but overall enjoyable
the siralim series is AMAZING. real random dungeon crawling at an excellent price, as deep (or not) as you want. i own all three on steam and android. 100% worth.
Pokemon for adults. Need i say more?

Very good monster hunting turnbased rpg. It can be as deep or as simple as you want it to be. Want to catch every pokémon (ahem) creature and min max all their stats? You can do that. Want to stick with the first creatures you find and beat up everything you see? You can do that too. The best part of this game for me is how it synchronizes with the pc version. I can use the cloud storage system to pick up where I left off at home after playing the game on my phone during a 3 hour plane ride. Great game, buy it to scratch that pokémon itch
Very good. Like the others but way more to do and lots mo stratzzz.
An amazing monster taming rpg. Full of unique traits and crunchy stats that makes for very deep gameplay.
OMG i've waited for a very very long time to play this game on the go. I have bought all Siralim 1 2 3 in Android and Steam. Get very addicted. Love Thylacine <3
Seriously the best monster breeder/ taming game since DQM way back in the day.

I've bought all of the Siralim games on both Steam and Android and it was worth every penny. I've adored every single one of them. They're amazing games where you can spend a countless amount of hours. If you enjoy strategy, grinding, and collecting creatures this game is perfect for you.
Want a game you can sink hundreds of hours into and still have things to do? Buy this game.
great game. Everything the description said it was!!!
Amazing game, console quality content. No IAP

The game is unfortunately running very sluggish on a galaxy s7. I can not give a better review until the problem is fixed. Did not have the issue with siralim 2 Edit: changed to 1 star. Until the sluggishness is fixed, I can't even enjoy the damn game. Would refund if I could
Siralim 3 on mobile, baby!
Still one of the best RPGs on mobile

Other than being a bit sluggish compared to PC version on (Xiaomi Mi Mix), which was unexpected honestly, this is great. As such I would only use the Android version if I wished to play away from home, but the game is still awesome.

More Siralim with a ton of quality of life improvements and an interesting story. It doesn't run poorly but, could probably use some further optimization. That being said, I'm very appreciative of how fast it was ported to the Play store so I could jam on some more Siralim. :D Overall, highly recommend.

Love it so far, its amazing. The only thing i have a problem with is controls, but the dev said he will come out with a patch in the next few days so you can change the button layout like you can with 1 and 2. Edit: fixed, thanks!

content: A great dungeon crawl monster breeding and collecting game.

Awesome, except that turbo mode isn't working with my gamepad.

I really like it a lot. I only have 1 issue. It needs optimization for full screen mode on the Samsung Galaxy Note 8 smartphone. I manually turn on full screen and it fills the screen fine. But when I try to change the touch button configuration it won't allow me to move the virtual joystick further to the left. I'm assuming it's because it isn't optimized for full screen mode. I'd just like to able to move that dang thing more to the side! Thanks!
Loved the PC version, now i love the mobility

I bought this on steam and here, I love this game but the control is really awkward to play especially taking into account that this game have like 1000 hours worth of content, totally understand that it just got release but the control and UI really needs rework for Android port for touch control,otherwise this is a PERFECT game on Android. Thanks for the reply, while the update is helpful, what I mean is there shouldn't be virtual button in the first place, it should be control using touch screen alone to optimize the gameplay experience.
replyContent: I definitely understand your concern! The game is just too massive to rely on touch-based buttons for every single thing. A lot of information is displayed to the player at one time, so it doesn't make sense to try to cram a bunch of buttons on the screen at once - it would hurt the game more than it would help it.

content: A BIG 5* to the best dev on the app store. Hands down, besides y'all making one of my favorite RPG games series, y'all are consistently active with listening to the players and pushing hotfixes quickly. Brb gotta log a couple 100 hours into this one. Cheers!

Great game Been looking forward to this for a long time. Only gripe is...The Dpad and buttons are rather large and obstructive. Is there any way of shrinking / moving the Dpad and perhaps giving an option to increase its transparency?
Played 1 + 2 waited for this to come out on Android. Very excited to finally get to play it!
Who can say no to more Siralim adventure? I know I can't!
Thanks for the awesome game Thylacine!

I've always been very thankful that I stumbled onto the first siralim on PC; growing up Dragon Quest Monsters was always my favorite game, and the siralim series take many of the aspects I loved about that game and expands on them in really well thought out and creative ways. While the game itself is good, I especially appreciate that the developer always listens to suggestions and implements quality of life improvements to help make the game smoother and more user friendly as time goes on. Thanks much for the continued development of this game, I look forward to seeing what you produce in the future! -Michael
